title: Hands-on Exercise 1
text:
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)





exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

title: In-Class Ex04
text: pacman::p_load(rstatix, gt, patchwork, tidyverse, webshot2, ggstatsplot)

title: In-Class Ex04
text: pacman::p_load(rstatix, gt, patchwork, tidyverse, webshot2, ggstatsplot)

title: In-Class Ex04
text:
Visualising Normal Distribution
If the data is normally distributed, the points in a Q-Q plot will lie on a straight diagonal line. Conversely, if the points deviate significantly from the straight diagonal line, then it’s less likely that the data is normally distributed.

The plotThe code chunk










ggplot(exam_data,
       aes(sample=ENGLISH)) +
  stat_qq() +
  stat_qq_line()










Note



We can see that the points deviate significantly from the straight diagonal line. This is a clear indication that the set of data is not normally distributed.



Combining Statistical graph and analysis table

The plotThe code chunk










qq <- ggplot(exam_data,
             aes(sample=ENGLISH)) +
 stat_qq() +
 stat_qq_line()

sw_t <- exam_data %>%
  shapiro_test(ENGLISH) %>%
  gt()

tmp <- tempfile(fileext = '.png')
gtsave(sw_t, tmp)
table_png <- png::readPNG(tmp,native = TRUE)

qq + table_png

title: In-Class Ex04
section: Student T-test using a Histogram for ENGLISH
text:
Student T-test using a Histogram for ENGLISH

set.seed(1234)

gghistostats(
  data = exam_data,
  x = ENGLISH,
  type = "p",
  test.value = 60,
  xlab = "English scores"
)

title: In-Class Ex04
text:
Welch test for MATHS

ggbetweenstats(
  data = exam_data,
  x = GENDER, 
  y = MATHS,
  type = "p",
  messages = FALSE
)

title: Take Home Exercise 1
text: City of Engagement, with a total population of 50,000, is a small city located at Country of Nowhere. The city serves as a service centre of an agriculture region surrounding the city. The main agriculture of the region is fruit farms and vineyards. The local council of the city is in the process of preparing the Local Plan 2023. A sample survey of 1000 representative residents had been conducted to collect data related to their household demographic and spending patterns, among other things. The city aims to use the data to assist with their major community revitalization efforts, including how to allocate a very large city renewal grant they have recently received.

title: Take Home Exercise 1
text:
5.1 Load Packages


Code
pacman::p_load(rstatix, gt, patchwork, tidyverse, webshot2, ggstatsplot, dplyr, plotly, ggplot2, reshape2, readr, matrixStats)

title: Take Home Exercise 1
text:
5.2 Import Data


Code
participants_df <- read_csv("data/Participants.csv")
finance_df <- read_csv("data/FinancialJournal.csv")

title: Take Home Exercise 1
text:
5.3 Data Issue

5.3.1 Data Duplication
To prevent any double counting of a similar event, data duplication check and removal are to be executed to ensure higher data accuracy. Feel free to view the codes below that are being used to removal duplication.


Code
participants_df2 <- participants_df %>% distinct()
finance_df2 <- finance_df %>% distinct()
